title: Careers in Music: Creating Value through Innovative Artistic Projects
description: 2 credits. NP. Group C. This course teaches entrepreneurship and leadership through innovative collaborative term-long projects. Working from the psychological framework of the growth mindset and emotional intelligence, students articulate their artistic mission and purpose and then divide up into collaborative project groups based on common missions. They learn how to innovate using the creativity problem-solving process and design thinking. They create, pitch, and implement artistic projects in an environment that encourages taking risks and learning from experience. Students also learn the art of collaboration including communication skills and leveraging communication styles, conflict management, and effective persuasion and presentation. The class combines instruction with group discussion, coaching, and feedback from fellow students, faculty, and professional and alumni mentors. Course requirements include successful completion of the project, weekly readings and assignments, a final paper, and in-class presentations. Enrollment is limited to sixteen and is by permission of the instructor. Attendance is mandatory with one excused absence.
